conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
The liquid sources are labeled A, B, and C.
The baffles are the vertical bars in the middle of the image.
The liquid from A flows down and is directed by the baffle to the right.
The liquid from B flows down and is directed by the baffle to the left.
The liquid from C flows down and is directed by the baffle to the right.
The liquid from A is directed to the right and flows into container D.
The liquid from B is directed to the left and flows into container E.
The liquid from C is directed to the right and flows into container D.
Liquid from A flows into container D.
Liquid from B flows into container E.
Liquid from C flows into container D.
The liquid from A and C will flow into container D.
The liquid from B will flow into container E.
The final answer is: The liquid from A and C will flow into container D, and the liquid from B will flow into container E.
